...and here we are being torn apart by kids with guns and a Dutch bigot.
I mean, the Tunisians just won a Nobel Prize for trying to form a pluralistic society out of the ruins of a North African dictatorship...
Both "groups" (amorphous blobs) want to make Australia something it has never been. Try to appease either side and Australia loses.
Make no mistake, Islamic extremists and anti-Muslim anti-immigrant rabblerousers are two sides of the same anti-progress coin.
You can't sit on your hobby horse of Muslim-bashing and not deal with Geert Wilders, Pauline Hanson etc.
Should we talk about Islamic extremism? Yes. Should we also talk about racism and crypto-fascism? Double yes.
We will raise high the body of one child to justify abetting the incarceration and refoulement of others. That is the Australian way.
We've known for at least 14 years that our government will lie to us about refugees, and we swallow those lies every time.
Remember, our response to Children Overboard wasn't compassion, it was condemnation. And our attitude has only gotten worse.
If you think returning to a warzone or languishing in an island prison are viable alternatives to drowning, you won't change your mind (2/2)
Drowned refugees in Europe won't change Australian idea that we should stop the boats (1/2)

Unless Peta makes sure Tony has his nap each arvo, he'll issue letters of marque against Indonesian fishing boats until its past bedtime.
